class Block

Detailed Description

Block action and event callbacks. An action or event callback is a class that implements the method perform() and is used to handle specific block events and actions.

Definition at line 40 of file block_handler.hpp.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum uStreamLib::BlockHandler::HandlerReturnValue
 

Return values for method perform().

Enumeration values:
HSUCCESS  the handler did its job correctly
HFAILURE  the handler failed to make its job
HCRITICAL  the handler encountered a critical failure

Definition at line 76 of file block_handler.hpp.

virtual int32 uStreamLib::BlockHandler::perform (  void   )  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Handler entry point. When creating an event handler, this method must be overridden. This method must return HSUCCESS for signaling a success to the block; HFAILURE to signal that the handler failed and HCRITICAL to signal a critical failure.
